result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.   CORRECTED 05-19-2016:  CFTS (credit previously granted was duplicate credit to 14CF1405)
Consecutive to: 14CF1405  (CORRECTED 05-19-2016 to include consecutive language)

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample if not previously provided.  Pay DNA surcharge, costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

Defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates the SEHR was scheduled 11/23 buy prior counsel had a change of employment. Deft is now going to be represented by Atty Conner. Atty Conner asks that SEHR be adj  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
From ODA re: enclosed amended information
ATTY Wishau files notice of appointment of counsel

Defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Jacob S Lohmeyer in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
